intro: Pedilonum uncinatum, commonly known as the hooked pedilonum, is a rare and specialized plant belonging to the family Pedilanthaceae. It is characterized by its unique morphology, featuring small, clustered flowers with bright yellow petals. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often in tropical or subtropical regions. Its leaves are usually narrow and arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Pedilonum uncinatum is considered an endangered species in its native range.
